dublin_core.dcvalue: The HELP mobile learning (mLearning) solution is a learning and enablement platform, aligned to the Kenya Ministry of Health's CHW curriculum, for health worker training and empowerment.
Caroline Mbindyo, eHealth Program Manager, Amref Health Africa, Email: caroline.mbindyo@amref.org

Three different geographical sites in Kenya that represent a varied cross-section of livelihoods in the country: 1. Kibera (urban slum neighborhood of Nairobi) 2. Mwingi (rural district) 3. Samburu (nomadic pastoralist region in Northern Arid Lands)
HELP: Health Enablement and Learning Platform

Client education and behavior change communication, Electronic decision support, Human resource management, Provider-to-provider communication, Provider training and education, Child health, Family planning, HIV/AIDS, Infectious diseases, Malaria and other vector-borne diseases, Maternal health, Newborn health, Nutrition, Parasitic diseases, Primary Care, Sexual and reproductive health, Tuberculosis, Violence, Water, sanitation, and hygiene
